intro: Salmea sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf salmea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Salmea sessilifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
